title: Worked Solution
text:
To find the slope of a line that passes through the points $$(-2,6)$$ and $$(1,4)$$, we can use the slope formula:
$$slope= rac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$
Plugging in the coordinates of the two points, we get:
$$slope= rac{4-6}{1-\left(-2ight)}= rac{-2}{3}=-0.66667$$
So the slope of the line that passes through the points $$(-2,6)$$ and $$(1,4)$$ is $$-0.66667$$.
